snippet: The ruling clears the way for the police, while enforcing other laws, to question the immigration status of those they suspect are in the country illegally.
abstract: Federal District Judge Susan Bolton rules that Arizona can enforce the most contentious section of its immigration law, provision that requires police officers to question the immigration status of those they suspect are in the country illegally.
lead_paragraph: The ruling clears the way for the police, while enforcing other laws, to question the immigration status of those they suspect are in the country illegally.
